name: 許書涵
objective: Heat is fundamentally transported by a temperature gradient; it flows from a higher temperature region to a lower temperature one. An understanding of this process and its different mechanisms requires you to connect principles of thermodynamics and fluid flow with those of heat transfer. A study of this lecture will teach you how to model the concepts of different modes or mechanisms of heat transfer for practical engineering applications.
schedule:
第一週：熱傳簡介 (introduction)
第二週：熱傳導，熱擴散方程式 (The Heat Diffusion Equation)
第三週：熱傳導，一維穩態熱傳導 (One-Dimensional Steady-State Conduction)
第四週：熱傳導，一維穩態熱傳導 (One-Dimensional Steady-State Conduction)
第五週：熱傳導，熱阻 (Thermal Resistance) 
第六週：熱傳導，延伸表面熱傳 (Heat Transfer from Extended Surfaces)
第七週：熱傳導，二維穩態熱傳導 (Two-Dimensional Steady-State Conduction)
第八週：熱傳導，二維穩態熱傳導 (Two-Dimensional Steady-State Conduction)
第九週：期中考 (Midterm Exam)
第十週：熱傳導，暫態熱傳導(Transient Conduction)
第十一週：熱對流，對流邊界層 (The Convection Boundary Layers)
第十二週：熱對流，外流場與內流場 (External and Internal Flow)
第十三週：熱對流，自由對流 (Free Convection)
第十四週：熱對流 ，沸騰與凝結 (Boiling and Condensation)
第十五週：熱交換器 (Heat Exchanger)
第十六週：熱交換器 (Heat Exchanger)
第十七週：熱輻射，史蒂芬波-茲曼定律 (Stefan–Boltzmann Law)
第十八週：期末考 (Final Exam)

作業、小考 40%

materials: 課本：Fundamentals of heat and mass transfer. 7th ed., 2011, Bergman, Theodore L., and Frank P. Incropera., John Wiley & Sons.
